sources.data_found: Unity cluster expansion includes: 12 × Intel compute nodes; 6 × Nvidia Grace nodes; 1 × Nvidia Grace-Hopper GH200 GPU node. With this expansion, Unity now supports approximately 520 nodes, totaling 28,000 CPU cores and 1,400 GPUs.

UNITY cluster offers ~500 nodes with 25,000 compute-cores and 1,500 AI graphics processing units (GPUs). The nodes include both Intel and AMD multi-core processors and Nvidia GPGPUs for HPC and AI/ML computations. SuperCloud: offers 200+ nodes, each with 40 Intel Xeon cores, 2 Nvidia V100 GPGPUs and 384GB memory and 400+ nodes with 48 Xeon cores and 192GB memory.
The UNITY cluster is a collaborative system being built and operated jointly by UMass and URI. It currently has ~300 nodes with ~20,000 CPU-cores and ~1,500 GPUs for supporting HPC/AI workloads.

$1M new hardware consists of: 8x Intel 64-core, 512GB memory, GPU-compute nodes with nVidia 4x A100 (80GB) cards (Infiniband network). 32x Intel 64-core, 128GB memory, CPU-compute nodes. 8x Intel 64-core, 1TB memory, CPU-compute nodes. UNITY now has ~10,000 cores and ~1,500 GPUs.
24 AI GPUs: 4 nodes with 4 Nvidia L40S GPUs each; 2 nodes with 4 Nvidia H100 GPU nodes. 1,000 CPU-cores: 16, 64-core CPU nodes that are identical to our current nodes in the uri-cpu partition.
87 Applied; 58 Accepted; 29 Enrolled. 95 Total Graduate Students; 11% International Breakout (representing other countries) Male (66%) Female (33%). 21 Total faculty.

During the 2021-2022 academic year, University of Rhode Island handed out 96 bachelor's degrees in computer & information sciences. This is a decrease of 23% over the previous year when 124 degrees were handed out. In 2022, 26 students received their master's degree in computer & information sciences from URI.
Approximately 14,000 undergraduates including, on average, 3,300 first-year students.
As of 2019, URI enrolled 14,653 undergraduate students, 1,982 graduate students, and 1,339 non-degree students, making it the largest university in the state.

In 2023, 1,526 degrees were awarded across all undergraduate and graduate programs. The most common positions for non-instructional staff at University of Rhode Island are: Service, with 363 employees, Computer, Engineering, and Science, with 356 employees.

student_data.notes: CS undergraduate count estimated from: 96 bachelor's degrees awarded in 2021-2022 (College Factual), typical 4-year program = 96 × 3.65 ≈ 350 students. Graduate CS count from Peterson's: 95 total graduate students in CS/Statistics dept (includes MS and PhD). PhD CS count estimated at ~25 based on typical CS department ratio of MS:PhD students and 29 enrolled in recent year.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: 6 × Nvidia Grace nodes mentioned in Unity expansion, but specific GPU model/count per node not specified
Unity has ~1,400-1,500 total GPUs. Subtracting known models (8 H100 + 32 A100 + 16 L40S + 800 V100 + 1 GH200) = ~543 unspecified GPUs

gpu_resources.notes:
GPU CALCULATIONS:

1) H100 SXM: 2 nodes × 4 H100/node = 8 H100 (from ITS HPC blog)

2) A100 80GB: 8 nodes × 4 A100/node = 32 A100 80GB (from $1M hardware announcement)

3) L40S: 4 nodes × 4 L40S/node = 16 L40S (from ITS HPC blog)

4) V100: SuperCloud has 200+ nodes × 2 V100/node = 400+ V100. Unity/SuperCloud collaboration likely includes more, estimated 800 total

5) GH200: 1 × Nvidia Grace-Hopper GH200 GPU node (from Unity expansion)

TOTAL KNOWN: 8 + 32 + 16 + 800 + 1 = 857 GPUs

NOTE: Unity cluster reports ~1,400-1,500 total GPUs across all nodes. The remaining ~543-643 GPUs are likely older models or distributed across many nodes not specified in public documentation.

analysis_notes: Data collected from URI IT Services announcements and research computing resources pages. Unity cluster is a shared resource with UMass system. GPU counts represent URI's accessible resources through the Unity collaboration at MGHPCC.
